access_lists.description: Access Control List entries for device or account

cidrs.description: Classless Inter-Domain Routing IP notation for use on the access lists

items.description: CIDR IP to use on access lists

user_agent.description: RegExp to match valid user agent strings

dialog_subscribed_mwi_prefix.description: prefix used when subsribing vm updates for dialog

privacy_mode.description: Default privacy mode for anonymous calls

attempt_failure_expiry_ms.description: webhooks attempt failure expiry in milliseconds

accounts.description: Accounts represent tenants or customers on the system. Each account represents an individual dataset or sandbox that only one tenant can access. The data set is architecturally independent from other tenants.

action.description: If set to deny all calls of this type will be rejected.  If set to inherit the user/device rules apply

call_restriction.description: Account level call restrictions for each available number classification

caller_id.description: The account default caller ID parameters

dial_plan.description: A list of default rules used to modify dialed numbers

enabled.description: Determines if the account is currently enabled

music_on_hold.description: The default music on hold parameters

media_id.description: The ID of a media object that should be used as the default music on hold

name.description: A friendly name for the account

org.description: Full legal name of the organization

preflow.description: Each property provides functionality that can be applied to calls using the callflow application

always.description: The ID of a callflow to always execute prior to processing the callflow with numbers/patterns matching the request

realm.description: The realm of the account, ie: 'account1.2600hz.com'

external.description: The alert info SIP header added when the call is from internal sources

internal.description: The alert info SIP header added when the call is from external sources

cidr.description: Classless Inter-Domain Routing IP notation for use on the ACL

description.description: Will be added as a comment for quick identification later

network-list-name.description: The trusted list should represent anything that can issue calls without authorization.  The authoritative list should indicate inter-network routing equipment (SBC, etc).

allotments.description: Create buckets of minutes per time-period

api_auth.description: Provides an auth-token via an Account API key

name.description: Application name

audit_logs.description: Audit log of what caused a billing event to occur

audit.description: Contains the accounts involved in the billable event (initial account and resellers)

^[0-9a-zA-Z]{32}$.description: The account's quantity changes for the billing event

account_name.description: The name of the account (for historical purposes)

account_quantities.description: The account's quantities as a result of the billing event

cascade_quantities.description: The account's cascaded quantities as a result of the billing event

authenticating_user.description: Information about the requestor who caused the billing event

tree.description: The account's tree (including the account), ordered from ancestor to account

clientId.description: client id, usually appplication id for oauth providers

enabled.description: whether or not this authentication provider is enabled

name.description: A friendly name for the temporal rule set

numbers.description: Map of caller id number to block

bookkeepers.description: The bookkeeper modules provided by Kazoo

enabled.description: Determines if server side call waiting is enabled/disabled

caller_id.description: Defines caller ID settings based on the type of call being made

emergency.description: The caller ID used when a resource is flagged as 'emergency'

name.description: The caller id name for the object type

number.description: The caller id name for the object type

external.description: The default caller ID used when dialing external numbers

name.description: The caller id name for the object type

number.description: The caller id name for the object type

internal.description: The default caller ID used when dialing internal extensions

name.description: The caller id name for the object type

number.description: The caller id name for the object type

callflows.description: Call flows describe steps to take in order to process a phone call. They are trees of information related to a phone call such as "answer, play file, record file" etc. that are logically grouped together and ordered.

featurecode.description: When the callflow is used as a featurecode this object tracks the intended match of the pattern and name of the feature

flow.description: A callflow node defines a module to execute, data to provide to that module, and one or more children to branch to

data.description: The data/arguments of the callflow module

module.description: The name of the callflow module to excute at this node

variables.description: A map of data object keys to custom KV keys whose values should replace the values in the data object

metaflow.description: Actions applied to a call outside of the normal callflow, initiated by the caller(s)

numbers.description: A list of static numbers that the callflow should execute for

patterns.description: A list of regular expressions that the callflow should execute for, with optional capture groups

callflows.acdc_agent.description: Validator for the acdc_agent callflow's data object

presence_id.description: Static presence ID to send BLF updates to

callflows.acdc_member.description: Validator for the acdc_member callflow's data object

priority.description: assign a priority to the caller

callflows.acdc_queue.description: Validator for the acdc_queue callflow's data object

action.description: What action to perform on the agent for this queue

callflows.action.description: Call flows describe steps to take in order to process a phone call. They are trees of information related to a phone call such as "answer, play file, record file" etc. that are logically grouped together and ordered.

data.description: The data/arguments of the callflow module

module.description: The name of the callflow module to excute at this node

callflows.after_bridge.description: Validator for the after_bridge callflow's data object

action.description: What action to perform after a call is bridged

data.description: The number to transfer to, or a boolean, depending on the 'action'

callflows.branch_bnumber.description: Validator for the branch_bnumber callflow's data object

callflows.branch_variable.description: Validator for the branch_variable callflow's data object

scope.description: specifies where the variable is defined

variable.description: specifies the name of variable/property that should be looked up

callflows.call_waiting.description: Validator for the call_waiting callflow's data object

id.description: The Callflow ID to branch to

terminator.description: What DTMF will terminate collection before the timeout occurs

terminators.description: What DTMFs will terminate collection before the timeout occurs

play.description: Should the Welcome Prompt be played

can_text_self.description: Toggle whether devices of the same owner can text each other

delay.description: How long to delay ringing the device, in seconds

timeout.description: Time, in seconds, to wait for device to bridge

bypass_e164.description: Use the original requested number instead of normalizing to E164

caller_id_type.description: Which configured caller-id to use (key in the 'caller_id' object)

custom_sip_headers.description: Custom SIP Headers to include on the outgoing INVITE

from_uri_realm.description: Override the From realm in the SIP packets

ignore_early_media.description: Toggle whether to ignore early media

to_did.description: Statically set the DID to dial

use_local_resources.description: Toggle whether to use the account's (or hunt_account_id's) resources vs the system resources

callflows.webhook.description: Validator for the webhook callflow's data object

custom_data.description: JSON object of custom data included on the HTTP request

http_verb.description: What HTTP verb to use when sending the request

retries.description: How many times to retry the request if the host isn't available

uri.description: The HTTP URI to send the request

cccps.description: Calling cards callback platform user's info

max_concurent_calls_per_user.description: Calls per user limit. Counts all user's legs and compares to max_concurent_calls_per_user multiplied by 2

retain_cid.description: Pass initial caller number to the callee

user_id.description: The ID of the user object that 'owns' cid/pin

app_name.description: The Kazoo application that issued the CDR

app_version.description: The internal Kazoo version number of the application that issued the CDR

billing_seconds.description: The number of seconds the call leg can be billed for (typically from when the call leg is answered

call_direction.description: Direction of the call, relative to the media switch

call_id.description: Unique identifier of the call leg

callee_id_name.description: The indicated name of the callee

callee_id_number.description: The indicated number of the callee

caller_id_name.description: The indicated name of the caller

caller_id_number.description: The indicated number of the caller

custom_channel_vars.description: Kazoo-specific key/value pairs set on the channel

custom_sip_headers.description: A property list of SIP headers beging with the prefix 'X-'

digits_dialed.description: All the DTMF tones detected on this leg of the call

disposition.description: Who sent the SIP BYE message

duration_seconds.description: The duration of the call leg, in seconds

from.description: Built by Kazoo, depending on direction, to represent the From user

hangup_cause.description: The reason for the call leg's termination

hangup_code.description: The SIP hangup code, if available

local_sdp.description: The SDP negotiated by the local agent

media_server.description: The hostname of the media server that processed the call

node.description: The ecallmgr which issued the CDR

other_leg_call_id.description: If this leg was bridged, the call-id of the opposite leg

other_leg_caller_id_name.description: Caller ID name of the bridged leg

other_leg_caller_id_number.description: Caller ID number of the bridged leg

other_leg_destination_number.description: Dialed number of the other leg

other_leg_direction.description: direction of the other leg, relative to the media server

presence_id.description: ID used in NOTIFY SIP messages

remote_sdp.description: The SDP negotiated by the remote agent

request.description: Built by Kazoo this is the processed request URI

ringing_seconds.description: How many seconds the leg was ringing (pre-answer)

timestamp.description: UTC timestamp, in gregorian seconds, of when the CDR was generated

to.description: Built by Kazoo, depending on direction, to represent the To user

user_agent.description: User agent header from SIP packet

clicktocall.description: Click-to-call allows you to create URLs that can be POSTed to with a phone number or SIP URI and create a phone call from the provided contact information to a destination you have pre-determined.

auth_required.description: Determines if this click to call requires valid auth-tokens when invoked

dial_first.description: Determinates what will be dialed first: extension or contact

extension.description: The extension to connect to when the click to call is invoked

name.description: A friendly name for the click to call

outbound_callee_id_name.description: Callee ID Name of the device calling out to the contact number

outbound_callee_id_number.description: Callee ID Number of the device calling out to the contact number

throttle.description: The rate that this click to call can be invoked

whitelist.description: A list of regular expressions that the click to call can dial to

bridge_password.description: the password used for a conference bridge

bridge_username.description: the username used for a conference bridge

conference_numbers.description: Defines conference numbers that can be used by members or moderators

focus.description: This is a read-only property indicating the media server hosting the conference

max_members_media.description: Media to play when the conference is full

max_participants.description: The maximum number of participants that can join

member.description: Defines the discovery (call in) properties for a member

join_deaf.description: Determines if a member will join deaf

join_muted.description: Determines if a member will join muted

numbers.description: Defines the conference (call in) number(s) for members

pins.description: Defines the pin number(s) for members

moderator.description: Defines the discovery (call in) properties for a moderator

join_deaf.description: Determines if a moderator will join deaf

join_muted.description: Determines if a moderator will join muted

numbers.description: Defines the conference (call in) number(s) for moderators

pins.description: Defines the pin number(s) for moderators

moderator_controls.description: profile on the switch for controlling the conference as a moderator

name.description: A friendly name for the conference

owner_id.description: The user ID who manages this conference

play_entry_tone.description: Whether to play an entry tone, or the entry tone to play

play_exit_tone.description: Whether to play an exit tone, or the exit tone to play

play_name.description: Do we need to announce new conference members?

play_welcome.description: Whether to play the welcome prompt

profile.description: The XML profile name used to configure the conference

require_moderator.description: does the conference require a moderator

wait_for_moderator.description: should members wait for a moderator before joining the conference

connectivity.description: Trunkstore configuration document - this is old stuff; do not recommend building off this if possible

account.description: Information that applies to the account as a whole

auth_realm.description: The realm any device in the account will use to authenticate with

trunks.description: The number of two-way trunks this account has purchased

name.description: Human-friendly name of the trunkstore account

servers.desciption: What servers will be allowed to make/receive calls via this account

failover.description: Route inbound call to another destination if this server fails to handle the call

e164.description: An E.164 formatted DID to dial for failover

sip.description: A SIP URI (sip:user@host) to call for failover

auth_method.description: What type of auth mechanism to use

port.description: Port to send SIP traffic for the remote device

name.description: Human-friendly name of the server

delay.description: The time, in seconds, to wait before attempting to call the server

enabled.description: Is the server ready for sending and receiving calls

failover.description: Route inbound call to another destination if this server fails to handle the call

e164.description: An E.164 formatted DID to dial for failover

sip.description: A SIP URI (sip:user@host) to call for failover

force_outbound.description: If true, will send the call over configured carriers instead of to the server (as opposed to the 'enabled' flag, which will reject the calls)

inbound_format.description: Determines how the INVITE is sent to the server

media_handling.description: Determine whether the switch should be in the media path or not

port.description: Port to send SIP traffic for the remote device

progress_timeout.description: The time, in seconds, to wait for the server to progress in the call, before trying an optionally defined failover route or terminating the call

sip_headers.description: List of arbitrary SIP headers to add to the INVITE

timeout.description: The time, in seconds, to wait for an answer from the server

per_minute.description: The limits to apply by a minute

invites.description: Count for the specified SIP method

registrations.description: Count for the specified SIP method

total_packets.description: Summary count for all of the SIP methods

per_second.description: The limits to apply by a second

invites.description: Count for the specified SIP method

registrations.description: Count for the specified SIP method

total_packets.description: Summary count for all of the SIP methods

devices.description: A device be it a SIP phone or landline number

direct_calls_only.description: Determines if the calls that are not directly sent to the device should be forwarded

enabled.description: Determines if the call forwarding should be used

failover.description: Enable the call-forwarding parameters if the device is offline

ignore_early_media.description: The option to determine if early media from the call forwarded number should ignored

keep_caller_id.description: Determines if the caller id is kept when the call is forwarded, if not the devices caller id is used

number.description: The number to forward calls to

require_keypress.description: Determines if the callee is prompted to press 1 to accept the call

substitute.description: Determines if the call forwarding replaces the device

action.description: If set to deny all calls of this type will be rejected.  If set to inherit the user/device rules apply

call_restriction.description: Device level call restrictions for each available number classification

exclude.description: If set to true the device is excluded from the contact list

device_type.description: Arbitrary device type used by the UI and billing system

dial_plan.description: A list of rules used to modify dialed numbers

enabled.description: Is do-not-disturb enabled for this device?
Determines if the device is currently enabled

exclude_from_queues.description: Do not ring this device when calling user/agent in queue

codecs.description: A list of audio codecs the device supports

bypass_media.warning: The string type is deprecated, please use this as a boolean

ignore_early_media.description: The option to determine if early media from the device should always be ignored

progress_timeout.description: The progress timeout to apply to the device (seconds)

codecs.description: A list of video codecs the device supports

music_on_hold.description: The music on hold parameters used if not a property of the device owner

media_id.description: The ID of a media object that should be used as the music on hold

mwi_unsolicitated_updates.description: When true enables unsolicitated mwi notifications

name.description: A friendly name for the device

outbound_flags.description: List of flags (features) this device requires when making outbound calls

owner_id.description: The ID of the user object that 'owns' the device

presence_id.description: Static presence ID (used instead of SIP username)

external.description: The alert info SIP header added when the call is from internal sources

internal.description: The alert info SIP header added when the call is from external sources

custom_sip_headers.description: A property list of SIP headers beging with the prefix 'X-'

expire_seconds.description: The time, in seconds, sent to the provisioner for the registration period that the device should be configured with.

ignore_completed_elsewhere.description: When set to false the phone should not consider ring group calls answered elsewhere as missed

invite_format.description: The SIP request URI invite format

number.description: The number used if the invite format is 1npan, npan, or e164 (if not set the dialed number is used)

realm.description: The realm this device should use, overriding the account realm. Should rarely be necessary.

route.description: The SIP URL used if the invite format is 'route'

static_route.description: Sends all inbound calls to this string (instead of dialed number or username)

description.description: Friendly name for this regex dialplan

prefix.description: Prefix the prepend to the capture group after applying the regex

suffix.description: Suffix the append to the capture group after applying the regex

dialplans.description: Permit local dialing by converting the dialed number to a routable form

directories.description: Allow a caller to search for a user/device by name instead of extension/DID

confirm_match.description: When one match is found, require caller to confirm the match before connecting

max_dtmf.description: Cap the number of DTMF characters collected from a caller, 0 for unlimited

min_dtmf.description: How many DTMF characters to collect from a caller before processing the directory

name.description: The name of the directory

sort_by.description: What field to sort on in matching documents when a caller enters characters

users.description: The list of users associated with this directory

items.description: UserId to include in the directory

mapping.description: List of hosts or IPs this host should resolve to

name.description: Human-friendly name of the Host

MX.description: MX records, typically for email servers

faxbox.description: FaxBoxes allow configuration of individual fax virtual machines

attempts.description: The number of attempts made, this will be set by the system and reset automaticly on put/post

fax_header.description: The name printed at the top of the fax

fax_identity.description: The number printed at the top of the fax

name.description: A friendly name for the faxbox

callback.description: A URL to send results to

method.description: The http method to use when sending the results

type.description: The content-type to use when sending the results

url.description: The URL to call back with the results

retries.description: The number of times to retry

attempts.description: The number of attempts made, this will be set by the system and reset automaticly on put/post

document.description: Parameters related to the storage of a fax document

name.description: A friendly name for the group

ips.description: IP addresses assigned to the account

limits.description: Limit an account's ability to place concurrent calls using flat rate trunks

allow_prepay.description: Determines if the account would like to allow per-minute calls if they have no available credit

burst_trunks.description: The number of two-way, flat-rate trunks used only if no other trunks are available

calls.description: A hard limit for the total number calls

outbound_trunks.description: The number of outbound, flat-rate trunks

twoway_trunks.description: The number of two-way, flat-rate trunks

name.description: A friendly match list name

org.description: Full legal name of the organization

folder.description: The folder the message belongs to

media_id.description: The ID of the message media object

timestamp.description: The UTC timestamp, in gregorian seconds, that the message was left on

content_length.description: Length, in bytes, of the file

content_type.description: Used to override the automatic upload type

description.description: A breif description of the media update, usally the original file name

language.description: The language of the media file or text

media_source.description: Defines the source of the media

name.description: A friendly name for the media

prompt_id.description: The prompt this media file represents

source_id.description: If the media was generated from a callflow module, this is ID of the properties

source_type.description: If the media was generated from a callflow module, this is the module name

streamable.description: Determines if the media can be streamed

tts.description: Text-to-speech options used to create audio files from text

text.description: The text to be converted into audio

voice.description: The voice to be used during the conversion

allow_record_from_offnet.description: Determines if the record pin can be used by external calls

hunt.description: Determines if the callers can dial internal extensions directly

hunt_allow.description: A regular expression that an extension the caller dialed must match to be allowed to continue

hunt_deny.description: A regular expression that if matched does not allow the caller to dial directly

interdigit_timeout.description: The amount of time (in milliseconds) to wait for the caller to press the next digit after pressing a digit

max_extension_length.description: The maximum number of digits that can be collected

exit_media.description: When a call is transferred from the menu after all retries exhausted this media can be played (prior to transfer if enabled)

greeting.description: The ID of a media object that should be used as the menu greeting

invalid_media.description: When the collected digits dont result in a match or hunt this media can be played

transfer_media.description: When a call is transferred from the menu, either after all retries exhausted or a successful hunt, this media can be played

name.description: A friendly name for the menu

record_pin.description: The pin number used to record the menu prompt

retries.description: The number of times a menu should be played until a valid entry is collected

timeout.description: The amount of time (in milliseconds) to wait for the caller to beging entering digits

metaflow.description: A metaflow node defines a module to execute, data to provide to that module, and one or more children to branch to

data.description: The data/arguments of the metaflow module

module.description: The name of the metaflow module to execute at this node

metaflows.description: Actions applied to a call outside of the normal callflow, initiated by the caller(s)

binding_digit.description: What DTMF will trigger the collection and analysis of the subsequent DTMF sequence

digit_timeout.description: How long to wait between DTMF presses before processing the collected sequence (milliseconds)

listen_on.description: Which leg(s) of the call to listen for DTMF

numbers.description: A list of static numbers with their flows

patterns.description: A list of patterns with their flows

category.description: Category of the template, for grouping purposes

attempts.description: How many attempts without answer will system do

disabled.description: Determines if the system will call to callback number

interval_s.description: How long will system wait between call back notification attempts

number.description: Number for callback notifications about new messages

timeout_s.description: How long will system wait for answer to callback

types.description: To specify types of the address

birthday.description: To specify the birth date of the user

note.description: To specify supplemental information or a comment that is associated with the user

title.description: To specify the position or job of the user

name.description: Name of the phone

queues.description: Call Queues - FIFO call queues for serializing callers connecting to agents

agent_ring_timeout.description: In seconds, how long to ring an agent before progressing to the next agent available

agent_wrapup_time.description: Pre-defined wait period applied after an agent handles a customer call

announce.description: Media ID (or appropriate media URI) of media to play when caller is about to be connected.

caller_exit_key.description: Key caller can press while on hold to exit the queue and continue in the callflow

cdr_url.description: An optional HTTP URL to POST the CDR

connection_timeout.description: In seconds, how long to try to connect the caller before progressing past the queue callflow action

enter_when_empty.description: Allows a caller to enter a queue and wait when no agents are available

max_priority.description: Maximum possible priority level queue will support. Can not be redefined for existing queue.

max_queue_size.description: How many callers are allowed to wait on hold in the queue (0 for no limit)

moh.description: Media ID (or appropriate media URI) of media to play while caller is on hold.

record_caller.description: When enabled, a caller's audio will be recorded

ring_simultaneously.description: The number of agents to try in parallel when connecting a caller

strategy.description: The queue strategy for connecting agents to callers

direction.description: Apply this rate based on the direction of the call (relative to FreeSWITCH)

iso_country_code.description: Country code this rate applies to

ratedeck_id.description: ID of the ratedeck this rate belongs to

routes.description: List of regexs that match valid DIDs for this rate

weight.description: Ordering against other rates, 1 being most preferred, 100 being least preferred

auth_method.description: What type of auth mechanism to use

name.description: Human-friendly name of the server

delay.description: The time, in seconds, to wait before attempting to call the server

enabled.description: Is the server ready for sending and receiving calls

failover.description: Route inbound call to another destination if this server fails to handle the call

e164.description: An E.164 formatted DID to dial for failover

sip.description: A SIP URI (sip:user@host) to call for failover

force_outbound.description: If true, will send the call over configured carriers instead of to the server (as opposed to the 'enabled' flag, which will reject the calls)

inbound_format.description: Determines how the INVITE is sent to the server

media_handling.description: Determine whether the switch should be in the media path or not

progress_timeout.description: The time, in seconds, to wait for the server to progress in the call, before trying an optionally defined failover route or terminating the call

sip_headers.description: List of arbitrary SIP headers to add to the INVITE

timeout.description: The time, in seconds, to wait for an answer from the server

type.description: The type of the document (pvt_type in Crossbar docs)

ubiquiti_auth.description: Provides an auth-token via Ubiquiti's SSO

user_auth.description: Provides an auth-token via user credentials

account_name.description: The account name of the user

account_realm.description: The account realm of the user

credentials.description: A hash of the uses credentials

phone_number.description: A phone number assigned to the users account

user_auth_recovery.description: Send a reset-your-password email via user credentials

account_name.description: The account name of the user

account_realm.description: The account realm of the user

phone_number.description: A phone number assigned to the user's account

user_auth_recovery_reset.description: Request a password reset from a trusted source

reset_id.description: The UUID that is part of the password-reset link

direct_calls_only.description: Determines if the calls that are not directly sent to the device should be forwarded

enabled.description: Determines if the call forwarding should be used

failover.description: Enable the call-forwarding parameters if the device is offline

ignore_early_media.description: The option to determine if early media from the call forwarded number should ignored

keep_caller_id.description: Determines if the caller id is kept when the call is forwarded, if not the devices caller id is used

number.description: The number to forward calls to

require_keypress.description: Determines if the callee is prompted to press 1 to accept the call

substitute.description: Determines if the call forwarding replaces the device

action.description: If set to deny all calls of this type will be rejected.  If set to inherit the user/device rules apply

call_restriction.description: Device level call restrictions for each available number classification

exclude.description: If set to true the device is excluded from the contact list

dial_plan.description: A list of rules used to modify dialed numbers

directories.description: Provides the mappings for what directory the user is a part of (the key), and what callflow (the value) to invoke if the user is selected by the caller.

enabled.description: Is do-not-disturb enabled for this user?
Determines if the user is currently enabled

feature_level.description: The user level for assigning feature sets

first_name.description: The first name of the user

enabled.description: Determines if the user has hotdesking enabled

keep_logged_in_elsewhere.description: Determines if user should be able to login to mutliple phones simultaneously

require_pin.description: Determines if user requires a pin to change the hotdesk state

last_name.description: The last name of the user

codecs.description: A list of audio codecs the device supports

bypass_media.warning: The string type is deprecated, please use this as a boolean

ignore_early_media.description: The option to determine if early media from the device should always be ignored

progress_timeout.description: The progress timeout to apply to the device (seconds)

codecs.description: A list of video codecs the device supports

music_on_hold.description: The music on hold parameters used if not a property of the device owner

media_id.description: The ID of a media object that should be used as the music on hold

presence_id.description: Static presence ID (used instead of SIP username)

priv_level.description: The privilege level of the user

pronounced_name.description: Name pronounced by user to introduce himself to conference members

media_id.description: The ID of a media object that should be used as the music on hold

require_password_update.description: UI flag that the user should update their password.

external.description: The alert info SIP header added when the call is from internal sources

internal.description: The alert info SIP header added when the call is from external sources

username.description: The GUI login username - alpha-numeric, dashes, at symbol, periods, plusses, and underscores allowed

verified.description: Determines if the user has been verified

vm_to_email_enabled.description: Determines if the user would like voicemails emailed to them

check_if_owner.description: Determines if when the user calls their own voicemail they should be prompted to sign in

delete_after_notify.description: Delete the voicemail after the notification has been sent
delete_after_notify.warning: Voicemail is not stored in the database if this option is selected

is_setup.description: Determines if the user has completed the initial configuration

unavailable.description: The ID of a media object that should be used as the unavailable greeting

name.description: A friendly name for the voicemail box

not_configurable.description: Determines if the user can configure this voicemail.

notify_email_addresses.description: List of email addresses to send notifications to (in addition to owner's email, if any)

owner_id.description: The ID of the user object that 'owns' the voicemail box

pin.description: The pin number for the voicemail box

require_pin.description: Determines if a pin is required to check the voicemail from the users devices

save_after_notify.description: Save the voicemail after the notification has been sent

skip_greeting.description: Determines if the greeting should be skipped

skip_instructions.description: Determines if the instructions after the greeting and prior to composing a message should be played

webhook_attempts.description: Log of an attempt to send a webhook to a third-party server

response_body.description: HTTP response body received, if any

response_code.description: HTTP response code received, if any

result.description: Whether the attempt succeeded or not

retries_left.description: How many retries were left after this attempt

webhooks.description: Web Hooks are subscriptions to allowed events that, when the event occurs, the event data is sent to the uri set in the Web Hook document.

custom_data.description: These properties will be added to the event and will overwrite existing values.

enabled.description: Is the webhook enabled and running

hook.description: The trigger event for a request being made to 'callback_uri'.

http_verb.description: What HTTP method to use when contacting the server

include_subaccounts.description: Should the webhook be fired for subaccount events.

name.description: A friendly name for the webhook

retries.description: Retry the request this many times (if it fails)

uri.description: The 3rd party URI to call out to an event

company_name.description: The company name to display to users

domain.description: This is the whitelabeled domain that users will be entering to reach the UI

fake_api_url.description: This is a whitelabeled API URL, primarily used by the developer application

hide_credits.description: When checkef this hides the credits

hide_powered.description: When checked this hides the powered by 2600hz on the bottom right

hide_registration.description: When checked this hides the ability to register for a new account

inbound_trunks_price.description: The price to show for inbound trunks, this is currently only for display purposes

nav.description: Properties related to navigation in the UI

help.description: The URL to use when the help link is clicked

learn_more.description: The URL to use when the 'Learn More!' link is clicked

outbound_trunks_price.description: The price to show for outbound trunks, this is currently only for display purposes

port.description: Parameters releated to whitelabeling port requests

features.description: The URL to use when the features link is clicked

loa.description: The URL to use when the LOA link is clicked

resporg.description: The URL to use when the resporg link is clicked

support_email.description: The support email address to display to the user

terms.description: The URL to use when the terms and conditions link is clicked

twoway_trunks_price.description: The price to show for twoway trunks, this is currently only for display purposes

get.description: Summary listing of devices for the account

200.description: A listing of devices created for the account

delete.description: Remove the device from the account

200.description: The edited device object, in full

post.description: Reset the device by sending a check-sync SIP NOTIFY

202.description: Notice that the check-sync has been sent

get.description: Summary listing of voicemail boxes for the account

200.description: A listing of voicemail boxes for the account

get.description: Listing of all messages on an account

delete.description: Deletes the voicemail box from the account
Remove all or a list of messages from a voicemail box

200.description: Listing of messages, if any are left

get.description: Listing of messages contained in the voicemail box

post.description: Fetch raw aduio of a list message id

200.description: ZIP file containing the raw audio of voicemail messages

delete.description: Remove the message from the voicemail box

get.description: Summary listing of webhooks for the account

200.description: A listing of webhooks created for the account

get.description: List the attempts Kazoo has made to the external servers

200.description: List of objects representing webhook attempts made

delete.description: Remove the webhook from the account

200.description: The patched webhook object, in full
The edited webhook object, in full

get.description: List the attempts Kazoo has made to the external servers for this webhook

200.description: List of objects representing webhook attempts made for this webhook
A list of available rate docs
